alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 12:05AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nebraska, including the following county, Scotts Bluff. * WHEN...Until 215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1104 PM MDT, The public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scottsbluff, Gering and Terrytown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
